Instruction: Combine flour and margarine in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring until they create a paste.
Whisk the cream into the flour mixture about 1/2 cup at a time until fully blended; then whisk in the chicken broth and parsley. Bring the sauce to a simmer, stirring constantly until it thickens.
Whisk together the egg yolks and lemon juice in a bowl.
Whisk the egg yolk mixture gradually into the cream mixture, adding about 1 tablespoon at a time, until the sauce just begins to simmer and coats the back of a spoon. Do not let it boil.
If a thicker sauce is preferred, mix cornstarch with 1/4 cup of the sauce in a small bowl; then stir the cornstarch mixture back into the sauce until it thickens, which should take about 2 minutes.
Mix the chicken breast pieces into the sauce until they are warmed throughout.
To create a lighter version, substitute light cream, low-sodium chicken broth, and light margarine.
